      • toSqlDecimal

        public static SqlDecimal toSqlDecimal(SqlType type)
        Converts a SQL type to a sql decimal with set precision/scale without losing scale or precision.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to convert
        Returns:
        the sql decimal
        Throws:
        KsqlException - if the type cannot safely be converted to decimal

      • canImplicitlyCast

        public static boolean canImplicitlyCast(SqlDecimal s1,
                                        SqlDecimal s2)
        Returns True if s1 can be implicitly cast to s2.

        A decimal s1 can be implicitly cast if precision/scale fits into the s2 precision/scale.
        • s1 scale <= s2 scale
        • s1 left digits <= s2 left digits

      • widen

        public static SqlDecimal widen(SqlType t0,
                               SqlType t1)
        Return a SqlDecimal wide enough to hold either the t0 or t1 types.

        Both sides must support implicit casting to SqlDecimal.

        Parameters:
        t0 - the first type
        t1 - the second type
        Returns:
        a type wide enough to hold either type.
